docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation for the Area project! This project is divided into three parts, each serving a specific purpose. Follow the instructions below to get the project and install the dependencies for each part.

docs.title: Getting Project
docs.text:
To begin with, in order to use the project, you need to clone it using the following command:

git clone git@github.com:EpitechPromo2026/B-CPP-500-MAR-5-1-rtype-theo.liennard.git

Once you have obtained the project, navigate to it to install the dependencies in each part of projet.

In the cloned project you will see three directory for each part

    AREA-API/
    AREA-WEB/
    AREA-MOBILE/

For each part you need to run the command bellow to download the dependancy.

    yarn

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text: Congratulations! You have successfully set up the Area project. If you encounter any issues or have questions, please refer to the project's documentation or seek help from the community. Happy coding!

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The goal of this document is to describe the game design of the R-TYPE project. It will describe the game mechanics, the different entities and the different levels.

docs.title: Movement
docs.text: Up Arrow Up Down Down Arrow Left Left Arrow Right Right Arrow

docs.title: Shooting
docs.text: Shoot Space

docs.title: Player
docs.text: The player is the entity controlled by the player. It can move in all directions and shoot.

docs.title: Enemy
docs.text: The enemy is an entity that moves in a predefined path and shoots at the player.

docs.title: Level Editor
docs.text: The level editor is a tool that allows the user to create levels for the game. It will be used to create the levels of the game.

docs.title: Controls
docs.text: Left click Place and remove an entity Left arrow Move the camera left Right arrow Move the camera right L Key Load map S Key Save map

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The Area Backend API allows users to configure and execute automation services. Users can manage their account, connect to third-party services, and define automation rules.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
• Endpoint: /users/register
    • Method: POST
    • Description: Register a new user.
    • Parameters: User registration data.
  • Endpoint: /users/login
    • Method: POST
    • Description: Authenticate a user.
    • Parameters: User credentials.
  • Endpoint: /users/update-password
    • Method: POST
    • Description: Update user password.
    • Parameters: New password.

docs.title: User Management
docs.text:
• Endpoint: /users/read
    • Method: GET
    • Description: Retrieve user information.
    • Authentication: Requires valid user token.

docs.title: Third-party Integrations
docs.text:
• Endpoint: /api/spotify-credentials

    • Method: GET
    • Description: Retrieve Spotify API credentials.
    • Authentication: Requires valid user token.

  • Endpoint: /login/google, /google/callback, /login/facebook, /facebook/callback

    • Description: OAuth2 login and callback for Google and Facebook.

docs.title: Email Service
docs.text:
• Endpoint: /send-email
    • Method: POST
    • Description: Send an email.
    • Parameters: Email content.
    • Authentication: Requires valid user token.

docs.title: Services Management
docs.text:
• Endpoint: /services/read

    • Method: GET
    • Description: Get configured services.
    • Authentication: Requires login.

  • Endpoint: /services/add

    • Method: POST
    • Description: Add a new service.
    • Parameters: Service details.
    • Authentication: Requires login.

  • Endpoint: /services/delete

    • Method: PUT
    • Description: Delete a service.
    • Parameters: Service ID.
    • Authentication: Requires login.

docs.title: Automations
docs.text:
• Endpoint: /automations/create

    • Method: POST
    • Description: Create a new automation.
    • Parameters: Automation details.
    • Authentication: Requires valid user token.

  • Endpoint: /automations/read

    • Method: GET
    • Description: Get user's automation rules.
    • Authentication: Requires valid user token.

  • Endpoint: /automations/modify

    • Method: PUT
    • Description: Modify an existing automation.
    • Parameters: Automation details.
    • Authentication: Requires valid user token.

  • Endpoint: /automations/status

    • Method: PUT
    • Description: Change automation status (enable/disable).
    • Parameters: Automation ID and status.
    • Authentication: Requires valid user token.

  • Endpoint: /automations/delete

    • Method: DELETE
    • Description: Delete an automation.
    • Parameters: Automation ID.
    • Authentication: Requires valid user token.

docs.title: Discord Integration
docs.text:
• Endpoint: /discord/oauth2/callback
    • Method: GET
    • Description: Callback for Discord OAuth2.
    • Authentication: Requires valid user token.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to Area! This comprehensive user guide is designed to help you make the most out of our application. Whether you're a new user or seeking to explore advanced features, this guide will provide step-by-step instructions, tips, and insights to enhance your experience.

docs.title: About Area
docs.text:
The goal of this project is to discover, as a whole, the software platform that you have chosen through the creation of a business application.

To do this, you must implement a software suite that functions similar to that of IFTTT and/or Zapier. This software suite will be broken into three parts :

• An application server to implement all the features listed below (see Features)

• A web client to use the application from your browser by querying the application server

• A mobile client to use the application from your phone by querying the application server

docs.title: How to Use This Guide
docs.text:
This user guide is organized into sections, each focusing on a specific aspect of Area. Use the following table of contents to navigate to the topics that interest you the most:

  • Section 1: Prerequisites

    Learn how to install dependencies and prerequisites for launch Area web site.

  • Section 2: Installation

    Install all dependencies for server and web.

  • Section 3: Getting Started

    Dive into the key features of Area, with step-by-step instructions on how to use them effectively. This section guides you step by step on how to use Area.

    • Register
    • Dashboard
    • Manages accounts

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, make sure you have the following installed:

  • Node.js
  • Yarn

For MacOS use Hombrew:

/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"

brew install node

brew install yarn

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone git@github.com:EpitechPromo2026/B-DEV-500-MAR-5-2-area-thibault.avon.git
cd B-DEV-500-MAR-5-2-area-thibault.avon

  2. Install dependencies for API: 

    cd AREA-API
yarn

  3. Install dependencies for Web:

    Open another terminal and past: 

    cd AREA-WEB
yarn

  4. Running server:

    On AREA-API, run: 

    yarn dev

  5. Running Web page:

    On AREA-WEB, run: 

    yarn start

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: You will arrive on this page:

docs.title: Register
docs.text: Register a account. You can use your email adress, Facebook or Gmail:

docs.title: Dashboard
docs.text:
The dashboard is presented as follows:

You can create a action in button "Create action"

In this section:

  • Name: how you name your action.

  • Description: a brief description on your action.

  • Reaction: you can add as many reactions as you want. Just press the 'Add new reaction' button.

You can add as many Actions / Reactions as you want, and you can activate or not this actions:

Customize it as you wish.

NOTE: you MUST be connected to the various services to perform actions/reactions. See Manages accounts page.

docs.title: Manages accounts
docs.text:
This page allows you to connect to the various services offered by Area. It is presented as follows:

Click on "Connect" for uses services.
